relatedanime.anime: Heavy Metal L-Gaim III: Fullmetal Soldier
Heavy Metal L-Gaim I: Pentagona Window + Lady Gavlet
Heavy Metal L-Gaim II: Farewell My Lovely + Pentagona Dolls

anime.description: In the Pentagona System, a young man by the name of http://anidb.net/ch39706 [Daba Myroad] leads a rebellion against Pentagona`s leader, http://anidb.net/ch39702 [Oldna Poseidal]. Daba`s not alone however, meeting a large number of allies along his journey and having in his possession the powerful L-Gaim, a white Heavy Metal left to him by his father. Source: ANN

tag.name: fairy
tag.description: A fairy is a type of mythical being or legendary creature in European folklore, a form of spirit, often described as metaphysical, supernatural, or preternatural. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: plot twists
tag.description: The plot and story of this anime may seem to be going along a quite predictable path, when suddenly there is a jarring unexpected twist in the plot, taking the viewer by surprise.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: rebellion
tag.description:
Rebellion, uprising, or insurrection is a refusal of obedience or order. It may, therefore, be seen as encompassing a range of behaviors aimed at destroying or taking over the position of an established authority such as a government, governor, president, political leader, financial institution, or person in charge. On the one hand the forms of behaviour can include non-violent methods such as the (overlapping but not quite identical) phenomena of civil disobedience, civil resistance and nonviolent resistance. On the other hand it may encompass violent campaigns. Those who participate in rebellions, especially if they are armed rebellions, are known as "rebels".
Source: Wiki

tag.name: imperial stormtrooper marksmanship academy
tag.description: When only the Bad Guys suffer from A-Team Firing. Also called The Principle of Evil Marksmanship. The good guys (the non-Red Shirt ones, at least - and sometimes even them, too) can stand in the middle of the firefight and never get hit, and can pick off any bad guy with even the most casually-aimed shot while the bad guys seem unable to hit the broad side of a barn. This is a degree of Truth in Television, as by far most shots fired in firefights or combat are misses. Some sources report that in WWII, the average soldier needed to fire two hundred rounds for every hit scored on an enemy; numerous other examples are mentioned in the Real Life section of this page. So the fictional bad guys don`t actually suffer from unrealistic inaccuracy; rather, the heroes`s fictional performance would count as Improbable Aiming Skills in real life. Or they were instead ordered not to shoot the person. Source: TVTropes

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Amandara Kamandara
character.description: Amandara Kamandara is a wealthy trader who sells goods to the Poseidal Military while also secretly providing goods to the rebel factions rebelling against Poseidal. He first appears when Daba attempts to return a cash card to him so as to fulfill a dying man`s last request, and shows up at various times throughout the conflict to encounter Daba and the others and provide advice and assistance. He is in reality, the true Oldna Poseidal, hiding as a merchant while a former lover of his, Mian Ku Ha Attsher acts as a puppet of his on the throne. Through the power bio-relation he has eternal youth, which he has also provided to Mian and former lover Full Flat. Using bio-relation he possesses strong control over Mian but as the conflict intensifies his ability to control her fades and he returns to Gastogal. There he reveals his true nature and acquires his Heavy Metal, the Original Auge. Battling Daba`s L-Gaim Mark II, he is virtually invincible until Mian is able to disable the bio-relation, causing him to immediately age to his death.

character.name: Oldna Poseidal
character.description:
Originally from the planet Gastogal, Oldna Poseidal is the main antagonist of the show, having taken over all 5 planets of the Pentagona system. The mysterious Poseidal rarely appears in public and when so often appears via hologram. Through the power of bio-relation she has eternal youth and has the ability to control others, such as Quwasan Olibee.
In reality, "Poseidal" is Mian Ku Ha Attsher, a former Temple Knight of the true Poseidal, who hides under the name Amandara Kamandara. Having fallen in love with him, she agreed to take his place but fell completely under his control and largely became a puppet of his, so much so that she believed she really was Poseidal. To keep up the facade she wears a bizarre costume, including makeup and contact lenses. As the years passed, Poseidal`s bio-relation weakened and Mian was able to think more for herself, particularly after the involvement of Full Flat. When Poseidal returns to Gastogal to return to his true role, she is able to deactive the bio-relation system that retains their eternal youth and she immediately ages to death.

character.name: Gaw Ha Leccee
character.description: Gaw Ha Leccee is a trainee for the Poseidal Military`s Elite 13 unit, stationed on the planet Koam. When Daba and the others steal a shuttle to head to the planet Mizun, Leccee goes on board in an attempt to get it back. After landing on Mizun she follows Daba and his friends, eventually deciding to defect from the military to join them due to falling in love with Daba. Leccee is constantly in arguments with Amu over him. She is a skilled Heavy Metal pilot. Eventually Leccee becomes frustrated with the rebel movement and leaves them, joining up with Amandara Kamandara`s group and acting as captain for the space shuttle Whale. She continues to assist Daba and the others throughout the rest of the conflict.

character.name: Gablae Gavlet
character.description:
An ambitious man from Koam who seeks to join the Poseidal military. Gavlet encounters Daba, Amu, Kyao and Lilith in the woods and a feud starts between them when he steals their food and attacks Lilith, considering her to be a bad omen. Through a recommendation from Amandara Kamandara he joins the Poseidal military and pursues Daba and the others from planet to planet, eventually being promoted to tactical adviser of the shuttle Slender Skala, and later to the Elite 13 under Giwaza Lowau. Gavlet pilots a number of different Heavy Metals but is constantly defeated in battle by Daba.
Gavlet eventually defects to the rebel`s side after falling in love with Daba`s sister, Quwasan Olibee.

character.name: Quwasan Olibee
character.description: Younger sister to Daba Myroad, the two became separated years ago and she appears as a member of the Poseidal military on the merchant ship Epsilon, which is secretly part of the Yaman Extermination Plan. Olibee is later promoted to Poseidal`s imperial guard, but as Poseidal`s "bio-sensor" suffers from mind control. She is always accompanied by Elite 13 member Rockley Ron. Olibee is kidnapped by Giwaza Lowau, who rebelled against Poseidal in part due to Olibee`s promotion. Daba and Gavlet, who fell in love with her try multiple times to rescue her, eventually succeeding. Olibee assists with finding Poseidal (Mian) during the final battle in Sveto. When the war comes to an end, Olibee is no longer under Poseidal`s control but has suffered brain damage, so Daba abandons his other friends to take care of her.

character.name: Daba Myroad
character.description:
Main character and pilot of the L-Gaim. Daba is a strong pilot and leader. Originally from the planet Mizun, he travels across the Pentagona Worlds, initially to return a cash card to the mysterious Amandara Kamandara, but also leads rebel groups in an attempt to defeat Oldna Poseidal.
In reality Daba is prince of the Yaman Clan, the civilization that ruled Mizun and was overthrown by Poseidal`s conquest. Daba, whose real name is Kamon Myroad seeks to overthrow Poseidal in order to attain justice for the Yaman Clan as well as his father.

character.name: Fanneria Amu
character.description: An aspiring actress who joins up with a group of bandits on the planet Koam. When Amu meets Daba and Kyao, in an attempt to steal the L-Gaim, she falls in love with Daba and leaves the bandits to join them. She constantly fights with Leccee over Daba`s affections, despite the fact that he only rarely shows feelings for her. Amu doesn`t have much talent, but grows into a rebel leader over the course of the series; captaining the shuttle Turner and eventually becoming the pilot of the L-Gaim once the L-Gaim Mark II is developed.

character.name: Mirao Kyao
character.description: Best friend of Daba from the planet Koam. Kyao is a skilled mechanic and pilot of the L-Gaim`s support vehicle, The Works. He initially has a goal of joining the Poseidal military, but multiple attempts end in failure and he remains a loyal ally of Daba`s.

character.name: Lilith Fau
character.description: Lilith is the last remaining fairy in the Pentagona world. Daba finds Lilith in the possession of a man in the city of Prearmo on Koam and purchases her from him. Lilith`s short stature prevents her from piloting a Heavy Metal but she frequently accompanies Daba when he is piloting and helps with chores such as cooking. Later in the series she helps prevent a nuclear explosion at the asteroid base Palarta Star during which she is seriously injured for several episodes.

character.name: Rockley Ron
character.description: Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 9). Rockley is assigned to watch over Quwasan Olibee, and is stationed alongside her on the merchant ship Epsilon, and later the Krepaul. He pilots the Heavy Metal Calvary Temple. He remains loyal to Poseidal when Giwaza gathers much of the other Elite 13 members and rebels. While he participates in the final battle on Sveto, his ultimate fate is unknown.

character.name: Wassan Lune
character.description:
Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 6). Wassan is responsible for the planet Mizun and battles Daba and the rebels when they return to the planet later in the series, teaming up with Gavlet Gablae and Lily Hasshi. He is an honorable veteran soldier, loyal to Giwaza. He pilots the Heavy Metal Bat-Shu.
Wassan eventually participates in an operation to infiltrate the rebel forces, posing as a member of the Yaman Clan. During the operation he meets Daba face to face and finds that he reminds him of his deceased son. His true identity is later revealed and he sacrifices himself in the resulting battle to save Lily.

character.name: Lily Hasshi
character.description: Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 10). Lily shows up to assist Giwaza mid-way through the series and participates in multiple battles against the rebels along with Gavlet Gablae and Wassan Lune. Lily is a skilled Heavy Metal pilot, using the Heavy Metal G.Roon. As the conflict intensifies, Lily continues to pursue and battles the rebels but is killed in battle against Amu while over the planet Gastogal.

character.name: Maph McTomin
character.description:
Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 8). McTomin is responsible for the asteroid base Palarta Star, however is absent when Daba and the rebels arrive at the base and liberate it. He later joins up as a member of Giwaza`s rebellion. He is at the head of the vanguard in Giwaza`s initial assault on Sveto, piloting the Heavy Metal A.Taul V.
McTomin is saved when Heckler Mauser sacrifices himself during the initial assault while fighting Daba. He later battles Daba again and is killed during Giwaza`s second assault.

character.name: Heckler Mauser
character.description:
One of Nei Mo Han`s wingmen, he later is put in charge of several assaults upon the rebel forces. He pilots the Heavy Metal Bat-Shu.
During Giwaza`s first assault on Sveto, during which he is part of the vanguard, his Bat-Shu is heavily damaged and he sacrifices himself to save Maph McTomin.

character.name: Stella Coban
character.description:
Leader of the rebels on the planet Mizun, Stella assists Daba and the others when they first arrive to the planet and they join his rebel movement. Daba and Stella constantly have conflicting views, in particular Stella`s habit of throwing money to the rebels. Stella also threatens his own allies with execution when he suspects them of disloyalty. Stella initially holds Amu hostage when Daba and the others first join them but she shows a lot of admiration for him.
Stella is severely injured when the Poseidal Military attacks his main base of Little Saye and is killed during another attack shortly after. His death causes many members of the rebel movement to depart in fear of their fate.

character.name: Chai Char
character.description:
Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 5). Chai Char is in command of the planet Koam and is Gavlet`s commanding officer when he is assigned to the Poseidal military. Chai becomes frustrated with Gavlet, as well as his superior Giwaza as a result of Gavlet`s constant failures. Once Daba and the others head to the planet Mizun, Chai follows and leads Poseidal`s forces against the rebels there. He pilots the Heavy Metal Bal-Bud.
Chai is killed in battle at the rebel`s Little Saye base. He is killed by Kyao, with whom he had conspired only recently before when Kyao was accused of being a spy by the rebels.

character.name: Anton Rando
character.description: One of Nei Mo Han`s wingmen. When Nei heads to Sveto, Anton remains on the Sarge Opus with Giwaza and is constantly accompanying him for the remainder of the series. He pilots the Heavy Metal Bat-Shu. Anton is one of the few members of the Poseidal military to survive the final battle and is taken captive by the rebels.

character.name: Hans Arahart
character.description:
Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 12). Hans is stationed at Sveto and remains loyal to Poseidal when Giwaza rebels. He pilots the Heavy Metal Calvary Temple.
When Amandara Kamandara reveals himself as the true Poseidal, Hans accompanies Mian to the Lachesis shrine in her attempt to stop him, where he dies.

character.name: Mahoul Senumah
character.description: Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 13). Mahoul is stationed at Sveto and remains loyal to Poseidal when Giwaza rebels. When Amandara Kamandara reveals himself as the true Poseidal, Mahoul accompanies Mian to the Lachesis shrine in her attempt to stop him, where she dies.

character.name: Pamela Birorejj
character.description: A member of the bridge personnel on the Slender Skala who is very dedicated to Gavlet. She is shot and killed by Full Flat`s forces while attempting to escape Full Flat`s Whale.

character.name: Miyama Lilin
character.description:
The leader of a group of bandits that attempts to steal the L-Gaim on Koam. Despite getting her arm cut off by Daba she tries multiple times to steal it from him.
Lilin is killed by Hashamoja, one of her own men after she had humiliated him in front of the other bandits. Later in the series her daughter appears on Trydetol and attempts to murder Daba to get revenge.

character.name: Full Flat
character.description:
In charge of the asteroid base Theart Star, Full Flat has been provided complete independence by Poseidal. Daba and the others first encounter her after leaving the planet Mizun. Later in the series she teams up with Giwaza to rebel against Poseidal, but has her own ulterior motives.
Full Flat was one of Poseidal(Amandara Kamandara)`s Temple Knights and vied for his love along with Mian. Full Flat was unable to win his love, but was given eternal youth by him. As the decades passed however, she grew bored with her life and resentful towards Poseidal for his treatment of her and Mian. During the final battle she heads down to Sveto and tries twice to break Mian from his grasps. The second such time she is killed when the L-Gaim Mark II accidentally falls on her.

character.name: Giwaza Lowau
character.description:
Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 3). Giwaza is head of the Elite 13 and highest ranked member of the Poseidal Military shown other than Poseidal herself. He is in a relationship with fellow Elite 13 member Nei Mo Han. Later in the series when Poseidal promotes Quwasan Olibee over him he gathers other members of the Elite 13 and rebels against Poseidal.
Giwaza survives an assassination attempt from Nei and kills her. His attemp to destroy Sveto with the asteroid base Metta ends in failure when Poseidal is able to move the entire city out of the way. While trying to escape he attacks Gavlet and Daba in his shuttle and is vaporized by the L-Gaim`s Buster Launcher.

character.name: Irene Irus
character.description: Captain of the ship Slender Skala, for which Gavlet is made Tactical Adviser of. She is frequently frustrated by Gavlet`s antics.

character.name: Semuj Shato
character.description:
Leader of the rebel movement on the planet Trydetol. He meets up with Daba and the others and becomes a key ally of Daba`s in the rebellion as it increases in size.
Semuj is actually a spy for Full Flat, but when this becomes known Daba forgives him and allows him to remain with the rebel movement as Semuj had become dedicated to its cause.

character.name: Ted Devilas
character.description: Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 7). Ted joins up with Giwaza to rebel against Poseidal and is responsible for the planet Trydetol. He assists in Giwaza`s assault on Sveto. His final fate is unknown.

character.name: Baan Gania Killas
character.description:
Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 11). Baan joins up with Giwaza when he rebels against Poseidal. Following the death of Wassan Lune, he is sent to Mizun to gather supporters for Giwaza`s rebellion. He pilots the Heavy Metal Ashura Temple.
Baan is killed in the final episode when battling Daba and Kyao.

character.name: Hassha Mossha
character.description: A selfish member of Lilin`s group of bandits. He and Amu are reunited when she is provided with the shuttle Turner, but he betrays our heroes multiple times and permanently teams up with Gavlet on the Slender Skala.

character.name: Nei Mo Han
character.description:
Member of the Elite 13 of the Poseidal Military (Number 4). Nei is a skilled Heavy Metal pilot, and pilots the Heavy Metal Auge. She is often accompanied by her wingmen, Anton Rando and Heckler Mauser. Nei is also the lover of Elite 13 leader Giwaza Lowau. She makes numerous attacks on the rebels throughout the series.
Nei is sent to Gastogal by Giwaza in an attempt to prove Full Flat as a traitor, but Nei`s long stay there results in him abandoning his loyalty to her. While there she meets with Poseidal (Mian) and is ordered by her to assasinate Giwaza. Her assassination attempt ends in failure and he kills her.

character.name: Mesh Maker
character.description: Originally a mechanic for the Poseidal military, Mesh defects to the rebels when they capture his creation, the Heavy Metal Amon Duule Stack, which was based on Yaman Clan designs. Working with Kyao, Mesh turns the Stack into the L-Gaim Mark II. He remains with the rebels as a mechanic for the rest of the series.

character.name: Eiman
character.description:
Butler for Amandara Kamandara.
Eiman is one of the few who know of Amandara Kamandara`s true identity as Oldna Poseidal. He heads along with him to Sveto during the final battle and is crushed by debree during Poseidal`s attempt to get to the Original Auge.

character.name: Allone Jelba
character.description: A member of the bridge crew for the Turner. He has a lot of admiration for Leccee.

episode.title: ファースト・アタック
First Attack
オールド・ソルジャー
Old Soldier
スキャンダル・P(プリャーモ)
Prearmo Scandal
スパイ・イン・スパイ
Spy in Spy
ドリーマーズ アゲイン
Dreamers Again
オリビー・クライシス
Olibee Crisis
